page.title: 15Housing
page.content: Few houses remain thatched in Wickhambrook and most of these have been modernized. Thatching was once cheap. The thatcher was employed on the farms to thatch the cornstacks &, after harvest, the houses. No thatch was then protected by wire as it is now. The work cost only a few pounds & not thousands as it does today. There appear to be more thatched properties in Lidgate than Wickhambrook (in relation to size). Wickhambrook is a much scattered community centred as it is on several hamlets-"greens". Most new (post 1950) building is near the B1063: Coltsfoot Green, Thorns Corner, Meeting Gr, Nunnery Gr, and Boyden Close. Nunnery Gr & Bunters Rd are the only areas of council housing; all other modern building is private. Mains electricity (1950), water (by 1956), sewerage (1972) were influential here.
